This is Aaron's Company's Q4 and full year 2020 earnings call. The company reported strong results following its spin-off from Aaron's Holdings on November 30, 2020, becoming a pure-play lease-to-own retailer. Q4 revenues rose 7.5% to $446.5 million, with non-GAAP diluted EPS up 11.3% to $0.79. Full-year revenues grew 7.3% to $1.73 billion, adjusted EBITDA increased 14.5% to $155.8 million, and non-GAAP EPS rose 22.5% to $3.27, driven by strong customer payment activity, reduced write-offs (down 300 bps to 4.3%), and disciplined cost management. E-commerce revenues grew ~35%, and the GenNext store remodel program reached 123 locations. For 2021, the company guided total revenues of $1.65–$1.70 billion, adjusted EBITDA of $155–$170 million, and free cash flow of $80–$90 million, assuming no significant economic deterioration or additional government stimulus.
